you find an article in a journal w/ open data policy requiring raw datasets & code.
article didn't upload data. you know there aren't privacy issues w/ data.
you reach out to author who basically says "I'm keeping the data until I publish on it again :)"
how would you handle?

This is a fairly staggering judgment from the CJEU. Were the UK still in the EU, it would raise serious questions of open justice, open data, and the compatibility of FOIA with GDPR.
